data.title: Wanted Chinese - not here
data.text: Food was not what we expected and will not eat here again. Actually got sick after eating, called and let the people know and did not receive even we are sorry.

data.title: Perfect Lo Mein
data.text:
I stayed in the hotel in the next block, so it was easy to stop in for take out. So, so news first.  The dumplings were too doughy.  I am used to a thinner crust. That was my only dissapointment. The Bourbon chicken was very good. Rich, without being too sweet. 
The Lo Mein was spectacular.  Neither  greasy nor soggy noodles.  It also had that smoky 'flavor of the wok' that cannot be replicated at home. 
If I do the same trade show next year, I will return.

data.title: It's okay
data.text: We stopped here because we were craving Chinese and it did the trick. Some dishes were good, the dumplings were eh. They have 100 things on the menu so you can't make everything superbly. I'd go for generic orange chicken and fried rice; it's hard to mess that one up. There is a cute little Chinese store attached.

data.title: Awful
data.text: We ordered from this establishment after checking in late to our hotel down the road. It was one of few places still open, so our choices were limited. We ordered the spring rolls, bean curd w/ garlic sauce, cashew chicken, and chicken w/broccoli. Every one of our dishes were subpar. The bean curd sauce was thick (like paste) and overly salty (not at all spicy like indicated on the menu). The spring rolls were soggy. The ingredients in all of the dishes tasted expired and over-cooked. Very disappointing.

data.title: Good food.  Good price.
data.text: Had the cashew chicken and the fried (and sugared) biscuits.  Very tasty.  Wish they had brewed ice tea instead of canned Lipton.  The fried biscuits were wonderful!  Returned the next night for biscuits to go!  Nice perk is the Asian gift shop within the restaurant. Fun items.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Could have been a better experience
data.text:
I was on my lunch break at 6pm. I have been recommending them to guests because of its proximity to the hotel. This will change.

I expect a little grease in anything that if fried, but the large egg roll was dripping it. I threw it away. I ordered the sesame chicken , but the chicken itself tasted rather old; unfresh.

They appeared short-handed, as it took 20 minutes to get my order. I had to scarf down what little of it I ate due to this. All of this could have been made slightly better if the order taker smiled.

data.title: Very Good Chinese
data.text: Red Apple is our choicefor carryout Chinese food. The food is always delicious an always arrives hot and ready to eat. They do not skimp on condiments or fortune cookies. The extra fortune cookies are loved by our dogs. Definitely my recommendation for Chinese delivery.
